intro: Majana macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked majana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Majana macrostachya is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
